abstract: Stephen Marche Riff essay asserts that movie Anonymous, which presents a questionable theory about authorship of Shakespeare's work, advances a shoddily constructed argument that is easily picked apart; argues that the movie underlines the fact that just because an opinion exists does not mean that the opinion is worthy of respect.
snippet: The only thing the new movie ‘Anonymous’ proves is that we’re living in a golden age of conspiratorial bunk.
lead_paragraph: The only thing the new movie ‘Anonymous’ proves is that we’re living in a golden age of conspiratorial bunk.

headline.main: Wouldn’t It Be Cool if Shakespeare Wasn’t Shakespeare?
headline.seo: Wouldn’t It Be Cool if Shakespeare Wasn’t Shakespeare?
headline.print_headline: ‘Wouldn’t It Be Cool If Shakespeare Wasn’t Shakespeare?’
